reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Don't go to the Parador if you need wall-to-wall staff and lots of entertainment. The friendly staff are unobtrusive and you may occasionally have to go to reception if you want a drink from the bar, but there is a very relaxed air throughout the hotel. The rooms are large and the more expensive ones have amazing sea views - well worth the extra. There are many other viewpoints from seating areas in the large gardens.We were only slightly aware of the ferries that bothered another reviewer - not a problem for us. There is a steep walk to the town but we are not in the first flush and could walk back up in 15 minutes!
reviews.title: Total peace - stupendous views

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Why stay in Tenerife when the ferry can take you to this nice getaway in less than an hour. Seemed to us like the bigger chains combine with a more intimate/smaller hotel worked fine this time. Nice people, nice surroundings. A big national park with thousands of options for foot walking, nice rooms. What more can you ask for?
reviews.title: Worth taking the one hour ferry for

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed for 7 nights and enjoyed the whole experience. Not everything was perfect but the setting, the gardens, the rooms and the restaurant were so different from any other place we have stayed. The buffet breakfasts are superb with a wide range of hot and cold food fresh fruit, meats, cheeses cereals and lovely fresh bread and pastries. Dinner in the dining room was enjoyable even though the staff rushing about did react with the serene setting.
reviews.title: Is there any where better?

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Easy to walk down steps into town in about 10 mins. but twice as long coming back!! Taxi about 6 Euros . Dined at El Charcon restaurant (through tunnel to beach by the terminal) and highly recommended.
reviews.title: heavenly place, ... not so excellent service"

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: this is really a great place to stay. The gardens are beautifull and well kept. The seaviews, the silence, the atmosphere. No loud and drinking tourists here.
reviews.title: Great location, delightful ambience, relaxing

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A lush tropical garden and a cool swimming pool surround this elegant building full of antiques and pictures. Maybe the service is a little formulaic, and the food a bit unexciting and traditional. We had a beautiful large room overlooking the sea so there was some noise when the ferries came in. Staff were attentive and pleasant and everything was as clean as a whistle. About 20 minutes walk from San Sebastian town where the buses and boats leave for all corners of the island. Join Amigos Paradores for special offers!
reviews.title: in a gorgeous garden overlooking the harbour

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The San Sebastian Parador is comfortably located close to the ferry port and the 'city' center of San Sebastian. If you do not have to carry too much luggage with you, you can easily walk up the steep hill to reach it. The building looks like a old Gomeran palazzo, but is in fact of quite recent age. The interior is tasteful, the garden and views on the sea and Tenerife are beautiful, the rooms are spacious and tastful. The restaurant serves quality breakfast and dinner, although the pace of serving the courses is quite high, like elsewhere in the Canaries.
reviews.title: Recommended but a bit sleepy

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Recommended since it is one of the only serious options in San Sebastian. But the overall atmosphere of hotel and restaurant is a litlle sleepy - which represents in a way the character of the island itself.
reviews.title: Excellent stay in charming building

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We've been welcomed by nice staff and assigned a large and nice room with quite balcony over a nice small internal garden. The only "negative" aspect was the internal parquet (slightly roumouros). Unfortunately breakfast is not include in the room pricing and the parking area is currently "under expansion".
reviews.title: Great Looking Hotel - Great Food & Location - Patchy Service
“ FABULOUS HOTEL – ONE CAN HIGHLY RECOMMEND”
reviews.text: Reading the reviews will tell you everything you need to know about what a lovely hotel this is and how nice the gardens and building are. So no need to go though it all again. I agree totally - Fantastic !

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I decided to go hiking on La Gomera and chose this hotel as a base for our day trips around the island. The hotel is located on a cliff above San Sebastián, which offers great views on the ocean, the harbour, the town and Tenerife, including the Pic de Teide, Spain's hightest mountan.
reviews.title: Beautiful Hotel in a fantastic location!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This parador has a wonderful old Spanish style with lush gardens. There is a beautiful courtyard with a fountain that serves as lobby. In this area of the hotel free and easily connectable wi-fi is available, as well as a computer for free use. The check-in was efficient and we were escorted to and shown our room. The hotel has a restaurant, room service, bar, a pool cabana and mini-bar in the rooms. The bar is open until midnight, has a nice courtyard to sit in and offers reasonable priced drinks and wine for a four star hotel. The pool, which was unfortunately closed for part of our stay (but we were informed about that prior to booking), is nice and clean and overlooks the harbour. The hotel gardens are well kept and have ample seating opportunities with often grand views. The overall athmosphere in this hotel is very relaxed and the place never seems busy. It is mostly booked by couples and though children are welcome and warmely received, there are not any facilities for them. Although the style of the hotel might imply some higher class dress requirements, the overall guests are very casual.
reviews.title: Breathtaking views, Canary Island grandeur

reviews.text: There are 60 spacious high ceiling rooms, with a good number of them opening up to the garden and the unique ocean view. Some rooms are located around a very nice courtyards as well though. The rooms are styled along the traditional Spanish theme with wooden floors, more than sufficient closet space, marble bathrooms with two sinks, bath tub and shower, A/C, ceiling fan and television. The balconies/terraces have chairs and a table to enjoy the nice outside setting. The rooms are very clean and well maintained. The materresses are great, but it should be noted that due to the old style of the beds, which are actually two separate double beds where the wood framing does not allow to push the materresses seamlessly together, quite a gap between the matresses remains.
reviews.title: stunning location for a peaceful break

reviews.text: The breakfast buffet offers a good variety of Spanish and international food ranging from hot items, over cereals, fruit to all kinds of bread and sweets. The restuarant setting is very classic with table cloth and nice tableware, and there are very nice double tables in a type of wintergarden that have nice views on the garden.
reviews.title: Service like in Sowjet state hotels

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: As the Parador is located on the cliff over San Sebastián getting into the center of town and to the harbour either requires a steep walk down- and uphill or the use of a taxi or rental car. What access to the best hiking trails on La Gomera is concerned San Sebastián is probably not the most ideal location as the island's best trails are somewhere between a 30 minute to an hour drive on curvey roads away. However, being able to stay at this wonderful hotel made these drives worthwhile. On a last note it should also be mentioned that the hotel staff was very friendly and housekeeping great as well! I am sure we will be back and I have very fond memories of this stay!
reviews.title: Without doubt a unique hotel and location.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I stayed at the Parador in October 2008 and it was great. The hotel is built in a traditional spanish villa style with lots of small courtyards throughout the building. The location is on the top of a hill overlooking the harbour and marina of San Sebastian and the cliff top gardens span 180 degrees with views across the channel back to Tenerife, and Mount Tide. The swimming pool is a very good size with plenty of sun loungers, and the pool bar does good quality snacks. The Parador is very low key, there were only small numbers of staff that were visable, as a result, it was a very quiet and relaxing environment. The hotel restaurant was exceptional quality for evening meals, but breakfast was a little lacking in choice, although the limited selection that was available, was very good. I would highly recommend this hotel as the perfect base from which Gomera can be explored.
reviews.title: Charming Hotel with Beautiful Rooms and Amazing Views

reviews.text: A hair-raising taxi ride takes you from the Port up the previously-described hairpin-bended hill to the Parador.
reviews.title: Not quite what we expected ...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is set on a headland overlooking the port, the sea and in the distance, Tenerife. It has a marvellous feeling of antiquity, although only built 33 years ago in very “old Spanish” style, with appropriate furniture and decor, and has the promise of being a peaceful and tranquil retreat.
reviews.title: ALMOST PARADISE

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It may well be exactly that most times, but unfortunately the car-park workings still proceed (see previous blog) and if you add to that the three main ferries that ply back and forth between Tenerife and other ports on La Gomera itself, (which leave their engines running at a steady thrum during their time in the dock) the noise level, at least in our room, was quite distracting. In spite of the fact that the room DID face the sea, any view we may have had was pretty well obscured by bushes!
reviews.title: Only stopped for lunch - but it was lovely!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: On top of that, the room above us appeared to be occupied by two clog-dancing elephants with a penchant for rearranging the furniture at all hours, and unfortunately all of the above meant that our stay was anything BUT peaceful or tranquil.
reviews.title: Fabulous location - could have stayed for longer!
